DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to find out if in patients with non-exudative age-related macular degeneration (AMD), randomly assigned to cataract surgery, any AMD size progression or progression to exudative AMD could be detected 6 months after surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Size Progression of Macular Degeneration After Cataract Surgery
DOC.criteria: Patients with cataract and nonexudative agerelated macular degeneration Patients with retinal pathologies other than AMD, exudative AMD, progressive glaucoma, myopia > 10 diopters, panretinal laser treatment, former cataract or vitreoretinal surgery, were excluded.
DOC.keyword: Influence of cataract surgery on AMD Size
